Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for caching, including expected data size, throughput, latency, and redundancy needs. Identify the applications and services that will use Azure Cache for Redis.
Choose the appropriate Azure Cache for Redis tier (Basic, Standard, Premium) based on performance, scalability, and high availability requirements.
Design the cache architecture, including the number of nodes, regions, and integration with existing databases and applications.

Tasks.Task: Provision Azure Cache for Redis Instance
Tasks.Task Description: Create and configure the Azure Cache for Redis instance in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Specify the tier, size, and region.
Enable security measures such as SSL encryption, firewall rules, and access control lists (ACLs) to restrict access to the cache instance.
Update application configurations to connect to the Azure Cache for Redis instance. Use connection strings and authentication keys provided by Azure.
Configure data persistence options if required, such as RDB snapshots or AOF logs, to ensure data durability.
Configure monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor to track cache performance, memory usage, and connection metrics.
Perform load testing and validate the cache performance under expected workloads. Ensure latency and throughput meet requirements.
Set up backup and recovery mechanisms for the cache instance to ensure data availability in case of failure.
Document the cache setup, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide guidelines for developers and administrators.
Train the operations team on managing, monitoring, and troubleshooting the Azure Cache for Redis instance.
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with security policies and performance standards.
